Authors: Suryapranata L.K.P., Kusuma G.P., Heryadi Y., Abbas B.S., Lukas, Ahmad A.S.
Title: Personality trait prediction based on game character design using machine learning approach
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 International Conference on Innovative and Creative Information Technology: Computational Intelligence and IoT, ICITech 2017
Affiliations: Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk No 27, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper explores machine learning model to predict personality traits of game players based on game character design they choose before starting to play game. The data for this study is collected using survey technique. The total number of respondents for this study were 94 people, which all of them are game players with the minimum age of 15 years old. The experiment results show that our model can predict Openness, Conscientiousness, and Agreeableness personality traits from the game character design selected before playing games with the average accuracy of 66.7%. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Seran Bria M.M., Kusuma G.P., Putera Suryapranata L.K.
Title: Promoting Timor Leste's Tais Cloth Using Mobile Augmented Reality Application
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program, Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program, Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Seran Bria, M.M., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program, Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kusuma, G.P., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program, Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putera Suryapranata, L.K., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program, Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The results of observations showed that the book about Tais produced by Secretariat de Estado da Arte e Cultura (SEAC) has not been able to meet the needs of users because the information is less interesting and interactive. This paper's aim is to introduce the more interesting and interactive way to introduce Tais. Utilization of Augmented Reality (AR) technology in an application built with the Unity3D program is done to provide different way in presenting interesting and interactive information to its users. Based on the results in this paper, the developed application can handle the presentation in more interesting and interactive way. The ideal distance in the tracking process for target objects with size 7 x 6 cm is ranged from 6 cm to 30 cm, with the image ratio that can be detected at the farthest distance is 4% of the camera image. For the detection angle, the target object can be detected properly from approximately ±640. From the data acquired, it can be said that AR can be used to introduce Tais in more interesting and interactive way. © 2018 The Authors. Published by Elsevier Ltd.
Author Keywords: augmented reality; cultural heritage; mobile application; tais timor leste
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Augmented reality; Object detection; Cultural heritages; Detection angle; Developed applications; Interactive informations; Mobile applications; Mobile augmented reality; tais timor leste; Tracking process; Application programs

Authors: Kusuma G.P., Wigati E.K., Utomo Y., Putera Suryapranata L.K.
Title: Analysis of Gamification Models in Education Using MDA Framework
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program, Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program, Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kusuma, G.P., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program, Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wigati, E.K., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Utomo, Y., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putera Suryapranata, L.K., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program, Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Gamification nowadays is being one of techniques that can increase motivation and encourage the involvement of users, particularly in education domain that requires teaching and learning activities to be more fun and interesting. This paper surveys some analysis of gamification models. MDA framework is used to identify surveyed papers by breaking them down into three categories: mechanics, dynamics and aesthetics. Findings from the survey show there are many gamification models in education domain. However, there are some very representative gamification models could be used as a method to increase motivation, achievement and engagement in learning activities. By knowing the latest gamification models in education domain stated in this paper, it could help gamification practitioners to make new strategies in learning activities to increase students' motivation, achievement and involvement. We also suggest some gamification strategies, which combine several mechanics in such a way to create dynamics that results in all types of aesthetics outputs. © 2018 The Authors. Published by Elsevier Ltd.
Author Keywords: Gamification in education; Gamification models; Student achievement; Student motivation
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Motivation; Students; Surveys; Education domain; Engagement in learning; Gamification; Learning Activity; Student achievement; Student motivation; Teaching and learning; Three categories; Education computing

Authors: Suryapranata L.K.P., Gaol F.L., Soewito B., Warnars H.L.H.S., Kusuma G.P.
Title: Quality measurement for serious games
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 International Conference on Applied Computer and Communication Technologies, ComCom 2017
Affiliations: Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Suryapranata, L.K.P., Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Gaol, F.L., Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Soewito, B., Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Warnars, H.L.H.S., Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Kusuma, G.P., Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: One kind of games based on its playing media is video game, which defined as a game that use any kind of computers as media. In terms of purpose, game has two types, which is serious game and non-serious game. As learning media, serious games need to have ability to motivate its player in order to play the game until the end so the player can finish the game while understanding learning materials given in the game. Therefore, the quality of serious game should be measured, like any other software. When it comes to measure serious games, previous models can't do the job well since all of them have no way to measure the game's content, especially to measure the content that can improve player's motivation. This paper proposes a new game measurement metric to measure the game quality factors, especially to measure serious game contents that can motivate its players. The result of this paper is a metric table consisted of measureable factors and type of test to measure them. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Motivational factors; Quality factors; Quality measurement; Quality metric; Serious games
Index Keywords: Computer games; Human computer interaction; Game contents; Learning materials; Learning media; Motivational factors; Quality factors; Quality measurements; Quality metrices; Video game; Serious games
